did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Correspondence, publications, reports, and subject files concerning Latham's work as a professor in the Division of Nutritional Sciences and his work in international nutrition.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Professor emeritus in the Division of Nutritional Sciences, Cornell University from 1968-2004 and Director of the Cornell Program in International Nutrition for 25 years.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, publications, reports, and subject files concerning Latham's work as a professor in the Division of Nutritional Sciences and his work in international nutrition, focusing on breastfeeding, infant and child health; parasitic infections and their relationship to health, nutrition, human rights and the World Health Organization.

controlaccess.head: Names:

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: Boxes 1-14 are restricted during the lifetime of the correspondent, except with permission from the correspondent and the Director of the Division of Nutritional Sciences.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Michael Latham papers, #29-2-3928. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

"Bottle Babies" a film about the tragedy of infant feeding practices in the third world. The film is 26 minutes, was directed by Peter Krieg, produced in Kenya and distributed by Unifilm, of New York City.
